ThingDef.label: barn owl
ThingDef.description: A medium-sized owl with a distinctive, heart-shaped face. They are renowned for their eerie, drawn-out shrieking calls. Barn owls prey upon small mammals which they locate with their excellent hearing.

ThingDef.label: eagle owl
ThingDef.description: One of the largest species of owl, the eagle-owl has characteristic ear tufts, orange eyes and an 'Uhu' call that makes it instantly recognisable. Due to its large size, it can take a wide variety of prey but typically favours small mammals and birds.

ThingDef.label: Kestrel
ThingDef.description: A falcon noted for the prominent sexual dimorphism of their plumage, with the males having a blue-grey cap. The kestrel feeds almost exclusively upon small mammals, aided by its ability to see near ultraviolet light, and performs a characteristic hovering flight whilst hunting.

ThingDef.label: crow
ThingDef.description: A passerine in the corvid family, the crow is a highly intelligent bird that sustains itself primarily through scavenging, although it will forage on occasion. Due to their dietary habits, they have been considered ill-omens, and associated with war and the occult.

ThingDef.label: cockatoo
ThingDef.description: A very intelligent parrot with distinctive crestfeathers. Their strong beak is able to crack nuts.

ThingDef.label: hornbill
ThingDef.description: This big tropical bird has a very distinctive beak, hence it's name. They are often found roaming forests for fruit-carrying trees.

ThingDef.label: Parrot
ThingDef.description: A treasured avian companion for pirates and collectors alike. The parrot is very well known for it's intelligence, strong beak and ability to mimic speech.

ThingDef.label: toucan
ThingDef.description: A black bird with a colorful beak.
